intro: Acritochaete, commonly known as the "false thistle," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers, typical of the sunflower family. The plants are perennial herbs with rough, sometimes hairy foliage and are often found in dry, rocky soils. Acritochaete species are native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
